subject: Bump revision number of objects when description is changed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-29 08:52:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/revisions/revision_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/revisions/test_revision_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/05e37d891cefd2268a4a72bdf752d12b5b2f2f24', 'message': 'Bump revision number of objects when description is changed

"Description" attribute belongs to the StandardAttribute class from
which many other classes inherits (like e.g. Network, Port or Subnet).
In case when only description of object is updated, revision number of
the object should be bumped but it wasn't the case for all of the
objects. For example updated description of the Network or Router didn't
bumped its revision_number. It was like that because StandardAttribute
object was the only one which was dirty in the session, and as it is not
member of the HasStandardAttibutes class, it was filtered out.

Now, to fix that problem revision_plugin looks in the session.dirty list
for objects which inherits from HasStandardAttibutes class (as it was
before) but also for StandardAttribute objects to bump revision numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1981817
Closes-Bug: #1865173
Change-Id: I79b40a8ae5d594ed6fc875572663469c8b701202
(cherry picked from commit 4c9cb83d6b46a6425e603194649a61f51a07a307)
'}]
commit_message:
Bump revision number of objects when description is changed

"Description" attribute belongs to the StandardAttribute class from
which many other classes inherits (like e.g. Network, Port or Subnet).
In case when only description of object is updated, revision number of
the object should be bumped but it wasn't the case for all of the
objects. For example updated description of the Network or Router didn't
bumped its revision_number. It was like that because StandardAttribute
object was the only one which was dirty in the session, and as it is not
member of the HasStandardAttibutes class, it was filtered out.

Now, to fix that problem revision_plugin looks in the session.dirty list
for objects which inherits from HasStandardAttibutes class (as it was
before) but also for StandardAttribute objects to bump revision numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1981817
Closes-Bug: #1865173
Change-Id: I79b40a8ae5d594ed6fc875572663469c8b701202
(cherry picked from commit 4c9cb83d6b46a6425e603194649a61f51a07a307)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/08/854908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Drop centos8s jobs from experimental pipeline

This is a follow-up to [0], removing jobs also from experimental to
avoid unnecessary runs. Since zuul complains about an empty project
stanza, remove the whole block, it can always be restored from git
history if needed.

[0] I32bef531896777bfb463bb401ebba1d488a16bf9

Change-Id: If68d548957adb8c6584dcab4582ef8396cccf0b2

commit_message:
[security] Make Ironic tftpd run as nobody

This avoids root privileges in tftpd's unprivileged container.

Change-Id: I50366205c9cefe2af26c27580c02368f029b7605
(cherry picked from commit f1d27f7ddbe897f08ca506e18e9f9cdffbf9bc59)

commit_message:
keystone: Remove redundant 'when'

In a multi-controller node, the presence of "run_once: True"
and "when: inventory_hostname == groups['keystone'][-1]"
will cause the task to be skipped

Closes-Bug: #1987982

Change-Id: I6a8f4ca285cda0675711b631aeed7ae4c992d879
(cherry picked from commit aa80f81d304c4734f8556740871d57d86f0190f7)

commit_message:
Fix IP allocation limit in overcloud inventory discover

After generating an inventory file in 'kayobe overcloud inventory
discover', the IP allocation playbook runs to allocate IP addresses for
the new hosts. Currently this runs without a limit, meaning it targets
all hosts. This change fixes it to use a limit of overcloud.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic3a98fb9e741a2dea792b2e6cf6a6ff802d099a2
(cherry picked from commit d4903676349b08c881a8785f92c2c24dede89e58)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/45/855145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _get_playbook_path("ip-allocation"), limit="overcloud")

Fix IP allocation limit in overcloud inventory discover

After generating an inventory file in 'kayobe overcloud inventory
discover', the IP allocation playbook runs to allocate IP addresses for
the new hosts. Currently this runs without a limit, meaning it targets
all hosts. This change fixes it to use a limit of overcloud.

TrivialFix

(cherry picked from commit d4903676349b08c881a8785f92c2c24dede89e58)

commit_message:
cinderlib: End of Life for stable/ussuri

Change I3860f7f77c1e put the ussuri branch of cinderlib into Extended
Maintenance on 2021-11-16.  Currently, the CI is running only one
functional job in excess of the required unit test and pep8 jobs.
All changes into the stable/ussuri branch since it was tagged -em
have been non-functional, which we interpret to mean that there is
no demand for keeping this branch open.  Thus we propose that the
branch be tagged ussuri-eol and then be deleted.

Change-Id: I75092342fe684892f8a73eab9ad5da4515cb1da5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/35/853535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - version: ussuri-eol projects: - repo: openstack/cinderlib hash: ab92ac4a02ef49f165a743747acea352386b13c8

commit_message:
Adding Michael Johnson candidacy for Designate

Change-Id: Id3102648edeff76c49fc1b691fdd8c894518ed78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/99/855299/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello OpenStack community, I would like to announce my candidacy for PTL of Designate for the Antelope cycle. I would like to continue to support the Designate team for the Antelope release. As predicted, we have continued to focus on cleaning up technical debt and improving the test coverage. For a small team, we have accomplished a lot in the Zed release, though we could use more reviewers to help with the backlog of patches in need of review and comments. I expect the code cleanup will continue, but I hope we can also focus more on some of the proposed features that are in flight. Thank you for your support and your consideration for Antelope, Michael Johnson (johnsom)

commit_message:
Add Martin Chacon Piza candidacy for Monasca

Change-Id: I8bcd761734b2129cb64bf5a6b79f33f0c7516182
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/22/855322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: I would like to announce my candidacy to continue as the PTL of Monasca for the Antelope release. I have been involved with Monasca since Queens release having the opportunity to work closely with, and learn from, previous PTL and Monasca's top contributors. I would like to keep most of the current topics: * Strengthen the community and improve active participation and contribution * Consolidate the project by concentrating on the core functionality (metrics, logs, events), cleaning up technical debt. * Continue to improve the documentation. Thank you for considering my candidacy. Saludos, Martin Chacon Piza (chaconpiza)

commit_message:
Adding Wenping Song candidacy for Cyborg

Change-Id: I6c4059af39aefda837a49a2f7b1dabe57eeff5e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/05/855105/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi all, I would like to serve as the Cyborg PTL for the Antelope Cycle. I have contributed to Cyborg since the Ussuri cycle, and have been a Core Reviewer for the Wallaby Cycle. As I am from an organisation that uses Cyborg, I feel it is appropriate that we contribute back in kind to the OpenInfra and Cyborg Community. Therefore, I have nominated myself for the PTL role to help out in this cycle. In the upcoming cycle, I would like to focus on the following: * Complete vGPU management * Refactor API structure * Enable contributors to add new drivers like SPDK/DPDK/GPU and so on * Improve usability and make it easier for people to start running Cyborg Thank you for considering my candidacy. Thanks & Best Regards, Wenping Song

Change-Id: I52164bde18f846de7d3261cdb8bdfdd71eabfcd3

commit_message:
Add Carlos da Silva candidacy to Manila PTL

Change-Id: I52164bde18f846de7d3261cdb8bdfdd71eabfcd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/89/855289/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Greetings, Zorillas and interested stackers, I would like to submit my candidacy to be the Manila PTL during the Antelope cycle. I have been the PTL for Manila since the Zed cycle, and have been contributing to OpenStack since the Stein release. It has been an awesome experience. Over the Zed cycle my focus was to continue mentoring and adding new core reviewers to the Manila repositories; Pursuing feature parity and complete support for manila in OSC (also increasing our functional tests coverage), tackling the tech debt; enhancing the documentation to help third party drivers to set up their CI systems; promoting events to gather the community members and getting bugs fixed and implementations moving faster. I am happy with the progress we made in those areas, but I still think there is room for improvement. During the Antelope cycle, I would like to focus on: - Continue our efforts to mentor contributors and increase the amount of active reviewers through engaging them in the community, teaching the OpenStack way and making it collaboratively as we did in the past cycles, promoting hackathons, bug squashes and collaborative review sessions. - Getting more features already available in the Manila core to Manila UI and get more attention to our changes to OpenStack SDK; - Continue pushing Manila to cover the tech debt areas we identified over the past cycles; - Enforcing maintainers to collaboratively cover the lack of documentation we have on third party CI setups for Manila, helping potential new vendors to quickly setup up their CI systems; Thank you for your consideration! Carlos da Silva IRC: carloss https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-August/030233.html

commit_message:
Adding Iury Gregory candidacy for Ironic

Change-Id: I86dd8337207c15305d6f703a39fcf8fdeec5ab2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/81/855281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello, Ironicers and stackers! I would like to submit my candidacy to continue serving as Ironic PTL for the Antelope cycle. During the Zed cycle we focuse in improving stability of our CI, with the drop of python 3.6 we switched jobs from CS8 to CS9, removal of networking booting jobs (the support was deprecated last cycle and removed now in Zed), among other fixes. The support for syslinux is deprecated now in Zed, meaning that support for use of pxelinux, virtual media with x86 in Ledacy BIOS are also deprecated because of the dependency with syslinux. Let's continue working together to make Ironic reach higher grounds. Best regards, Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira IRC: iurygregory

commit_message:
Adding Rajat Dhasmana candidacy for Cinder PTL (Antelope)

Change-Id: I17b74f36eeec1f0f3dba9c4600cb366a33f4eae8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/75/855275/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello everyone, I would like to announce my candidacy for PTL of the Cinder project for the Antelope cycle. I served as the PTL for Cinder during the Zed development cycle and targeted some of the areas which were lacking attention and worked on improving them like: 1. Review Quality Proposing the Efficient Review Guidelines[1] to help new contributors improve the quality of reviews. 2. Security Vulnerabilities Triaged the open security issues during the first mid cycle[2]. There are still areas which could be improved upon like 3rd Party Compliance checks and Cinder driver documentation which are good candidates of work items for the next development cycle and I look forward to actively work on them. Apart from that, there were deadlines which could have been better handled which I would like to incorporate in my planning skills so we get things merged in time and we won't have to extend deadlines frequently. Overall, I feel it was a good learning experience being PTL for the first time and I'm thankful for all the support I've had from the team, not to mention the advice and help from Brian while making critical decisions, and Hopefully I will take the learnings to be a better PTL this time. [1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/gerrit.html#efficient-review-guidelines [2] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/cinder-zed-midcycles#L136 Rajat Dhasmana (whoami-rajat)

commit_message:
Adding Brendan Shephard candidacy for Heat PTL

Change-Id: Ia693c2bdad2f4e0f92169082d7537284b938ec93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/19/855119/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi, I am proposing my candidacy for Heat PTL during the Antelope cycle. I have worked with the Heat project for several years both as a user and more recently over the last 2 years as a contributor. I see great potential in the project for our users and look forward to continuing work in order to support features and functionality of the project. Some of my objectives for the next few cycles are: Remove the dependencies on legacy python-*client libraries and instead shift to the openstacksdk client library. While the legacy libraries have served us well, they are starting to show their limitations and the delta in servicibilty will only increase as each project moves towards leveraging the openstacksdk. So this change, while quite extensive will ensure future compatibility with the other OpenStack project teams. Continue ensuring Heat supports the most up-to-date and recent features provided by each project. To ensure Heat is the default and best choice for our users, we need to ensure we are able to leverage the latest available features from the complimentary OpenStack projects. This is an ongoing challenge to stay up-to-date with the changes each cycle and work towards implementing them in Heat. Thank you all for you consideration, and I look forward to the next cycle and continuing to work with you all. Brendan

commit_message:
Add Pranali Deore candidacy for Glance

Change-Id: I70ab195d44541d03ac11a6428dc949d36d119ca8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/21/855121/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello everyone, I would like to announce my candidacy for the role of PTL of Glance for the Antelope cycle. I have been working closely with previous PTL, Abhishek since last cycle and I am hoping to contribute back to the community as a PTL while following his excellent example. Since this is the first time I'm proposing my candidacy, I would like to briefly introduce myself. I started contributing to OpenStack back in the Juno release (although not very actively) and started focusing on the TripleO & Puppet projects for Glance Deployment features and bug fixes in the Newton release. Since then I've been actively contributing to the same. Since Xena Cycle, I've started actively contributing to Core Glance Project, as well in terms of some features, bug fixes etc. This is how I want to focus for Antelope cycle, 1. Default Glance to configure multiple stores Glance has deprecated single stores configuration since Stein cycle and will remove the support of same in upcoming cycle. 2. Secure RBAC In Xena we have mangaed to move all policy checks to API layer and implemented project scope of metadef APIs. As per the revised community goal, we need to make all policy rules set scope_types=['project'] for all project resources that have already implemented scope as well as to have manager role support once it's fully implemented in Keystone. 3. Bridge gap between python-glanceclient and openstackclient The CLI support for all glance APIS is already there in GlanceClient and the similar CLI support we need to have in OpenstackClient for the missing Glance APIs in this upcoming cycle. 4. Community priorities Whatever community goals put forward by TC, as a PTL of Glance project will want to adopt these as a priority for Antelope cycle. 5. Other As we are very short team at this moment, I would like to put some efforts in attracting some contributors, help them to understand how Glance functions and encourage them to contribute for Glance. Looking at past how Abhishek, Erno and Brian has steadied the ship, I know its a big task and with their help I will do my best not to fail the expectations. Thank you for consideration, Pranali Deore (pdeore)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/59/855159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: I would like to announce my candidacy for PTL of Horizon for the Antelope cycle. I am serving as horizon PTL since Xena release and would like to continue the same. In the Zed cycle, we have completed migration to nodejs v16, angularjs v1.8.2, improved horizon-integration testing and completed a few other action items pending from previous cycles. In the Antelope cycle, My main focus will be on filling more feature gaps [1] like updating JQuery and closing more actions item from the previous ptg [2]. [1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/horizon-feature-gap [2] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/horizon-release-priorities

commit_message:
Matthias Runge candidacy for aa Telemetry PTL

Change-Id: I8cf40cdadde2da3c6fd5175a9d1b149a0e0ba707
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/11/855211/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi OpenStack Telemetry folks, I'm volunteering to keep the lights on with the Telemetry project. Beyond that, I have plans to - get more data added to ceilometer, e.g to expose names of projects, machines, etc. in addition to UUIDs. That will help with the usability of dashboards at the end. - get a replacement for the ceilometer data export to prometheus to fix remaining issues. - I'd like to conduct a couple of sessions during the PTG week on enhancements and also on CI. - finally, (and most important): get more contributors to the Telemetry project. Thanks you. Matthias

commit_message:
Test secret access via ACL

This patch enhances the ACL test to ensure that "other" user is not able
to get a secret before being added to the ACL.

After adding the ACL for the user, we check again to ensure the ACL is
working as intended by allowing the user now in the ACL to access the
secret.

Change-Id: I0b4e1fc71c62376301858128dd2fbb75bd1fa602

commit_message:
cinderlib: End of Life for stable/train

Change I1456592745c2 put the train branch of cinderlib into Extended
Maintenance.  A recent change, Ibd9f425e2cb7, got the CI running
again, but it is running only unit tests and pep8.  All changes
into the stable/train branch since it was tagged -em have been
non-functional, which we interpret to mean that there is no demand
for keeping this branch open.  Thus we propose that the branch be
tagged train-eol and then be deleted.

Change-Id: I25d78267ab4a49d3fe6bf54b7ad40e64a55a4609

commit_message:
Adding Rabi Mishra candidacy for TripleO PTL

Change-Id: I76baace42581ba36a6e0ab79294f9e2b5fcd66cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/10/855210/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi All, I would like to nominate myself for Antelope cycle TripleO PTL. As some of you would know, I have been part of the OpenStack community for a long time and have been a core contributor for TripleO and Heat. I have also served as Heat PTL for Ocata cycle. James has done a great job as PTL for the last few cycles. I would like to take the opportunity to thank him for all his effort and we all would agree that he needs a well deserved break. I am looking forward to take the opportunity to help the community to achieve some of the already planned goals, in progress workstreams like standalone roles, multi-rhel and other challenges that come along the way. Also, as before, our focus would continue to be on review prioritization, in progress work streams and collaboration on common priorities. Thank you, Rabi

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: I159452b2dfedee0e33d941da2c49692ea80aa987

Change-Id: I9a35160da50584eec713d52a46c80a1b5c70f96c

commit_message:
Add Rodolfo Alonso candidacy for Neutron PTL (Antelope release)

Change-Id: I9a35160da50584eec713d52a46c80a1b5c70f96c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/12/855212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello all: I would like to announce my candidacy for the role of PTL of Neutron for the Antelope cycle. Let me introduce myself first. I started contributing to OpenStack in Liberty release (2015). I've contributed to several projects, mainly Neutron, neutron-lib, os-ken and os-vif, in addition to Nova and devstack. During the last two years I've been focused on the ML2/OVN integration, QoS and Placement related features and helping on the Neutron CI improvement and stabilization. For this new release, those are the main goals I would like to focus on: * Take care and focus on the approved and merged Neutron specs [1]. Those RFEs should be actively attended by the community, from the spec proposal to the code review. In order to increase the attention of the community on these new RFEs, new ways of tracking them should be proposed (a topic that should be discussed during the PTG). For example, having a core reviewer “godfather” for each RFE. * Continue with the improvement of CI stability. The job done during the last 2 or 3 releases has been impressive, probably the hardest and the most continued effort on the CI in the Neutron community ever. We *must* continue with this effort and the current processes to track the healthiness of the CI. * Start working on the smart NIC / hardware offload testing. The number of backends (ML2/OVS, ML2/OVN, ML2/SR-IOV) make non-viable to test any possible combination. But at least, depending on the available hardware, we would be able to test the stability of those backends with the newest hardware offload NICs. Note: that will imply an external CI support. * Work with users and operators, providing an active channel with them. The goal is to attract customers to be actively involved in the community, participating in the Neutron meetings (team meeting, CI meeting, drivers meeting) or even creating a specific meeting with them in order to capture new needs or issues. * Live migration improvement, specially in ML2/OVN. This feature is still being tested and has not proven to be very stable. There are several core OVN and Neutron efforts right now but we still need to make this feature stable enough to be delivered to customers. A part from those main goals, we should always keep an eye on: * The SQLAlchemy 2.0 migration and any possible issue detected. * The Neutron's stadium ecosystem alive and healthy: this is a permanent goal in any release. The Neutron ecosystem is wide and diverse and it is maintained with few resources. We should focus on those active projects and communities that support their respective repositories. * Still closing the ML2/OVS - ML2/OVN feature gap, that is smaller every cycle. Thank you in advance. Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez (ralonsoh, ralonsoh@redhat.com)

commit_message:
Add docs for VMware deployment

Adds some contextual background information on how one can
deploy VMware using ironic, as it is a fairly common question
in data center management circles and needs.

Change-Id: Ib4843488be7d05366171fe55b0dc96d0f4410f48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/49/853549/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================ Troubleshooting & Ironic FAQ ============================ How do I deploy VmWare? ======================= While operators have indicated it *is* possible to use Ironic to deploy a VmWare Hypervisor, there are ways which are likely better than others. Typically operators have indicated they have create disk images, and then have used those disk images with Ironic's standard image deployment logic to place this image to disk. Unfortunately, this method lacks the ability to inject configuration. It should also be noted that VmWare has no concept of configuration drives. So what are my options? ----------------------- The ``ramdisk`` deployment interface is **ideal** for use in this scenario as it is modeled around one step operation to deployment methodologies. In this case, you shouldn't try to directly network boot the ESXi installer, but you should create an ISO image to boot the node from. This allows you to inject configuration into the ISO image which is read and put into place by the ESXi installer. Please consult `VmWare's ISO image documentation <https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.esxi.install.doc/GUID-A3F70933-B3FE-4A39-963D-100DE84035F8.html>`_ for detailed information on preparing and customizing this ISO image. Once you have a prepared image consult `Ramdisk boot <ramdisk-boot>`_ for information on how to boot/deploy an ISO.

commit_message:
Make keystone_bootstrap accept no ADMIN_URL too

To be able to drop the dummy arg.

Change-Id: Ibcc3e6b4e6015604c218e384d87de7b9e9aed4c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/37/854837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ $# -ge 8 ]; then # ignored ADMIN_URL compat mode # ADMIN_URL=$5 INTERNAL_URL=$6 PUBLIC_URL=$7 REGION=$8 else # no ADMIN_URL modern mode INTERNAL_URL=$5 PUBLIC_URL=$6 REGION=$7 fi

subject: Control molecule tags with test molecule script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-24 12:06:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/f222700f5ec9f27047981557a729158979638df1', 'message': 'Control molecule tags with test molecule script

Make test_molecule.py script reading scenario test_vars.yml
and react based on existing test_tags, molecule_tags_enforce,
test_skip_tags, and molecule_skip_tags_enforce variables of it:
* (skip_)tags configured, not enforced - molecule ignores it, leaving
  it for the converge playbook control or not;
* (skip_)tags configured, and enforced - molecule applies it, even if
  the converge playbook controls it as well (likely making it wrong);

This is required because converge may not always control skipping tags.
For example, include_tasks can only apply tags, but not skip it.

Also, molecule tags, if included, might conflict with tags management
of converge playbooks. So provided enfore-or-not it options help to
tweak that behavior case by case.

Change-Id: I0e3193c5f64457e55209891105df990c01dd2657
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Control molecule tags with test molecule script

Make test_molecule.py script reading scenario test_vars.yml
and react based on existing test_tags, molecule_tags_enforce,
test_skip_tags, and molecule_skip_tags_enforce variables of it:
* (skip_)tags configured, not enforced - molecule ignores it, leaving
  it for the converge playbook control or not;
* (skip_)tags configured, and enforced - molecule applies it, even if
  the converge playbook controls it as well (likely making it wrong);

This is required because converge may not always control skipping tags.
For example, include_tasks can only apply tags, but not skip it.

Also, molecule tags, if included, might conflict with tags management
of converge playbooks. So provided enfore-or-not it options help to
tweak that behavior case by case.

Change-Id: I0e3193c5f64457e55209891105df990c01dd2657
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/74/854374/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def set_molecule_tags(role_path, scenario='default'): mol_tags = [] if os.path.exists(os.path.join(role_path, 'molecule', f'{scenario}/test_vars.yml')): test_vars_path = os.path.join(role_path, 'molecule', f'{scenario}/test_vars.yml') with open(test_vars_path) as content: data = yaml.safe_load(content) if ('test_skip_tags' in data.keys() and data['test_skip_tags'] and get('molecule_skip_tags_enforce', True)): mol_tags.append('--skip-tags') if type(data['test_skip_tags']) == str: mol_tags.append(data['test_skip_tags']) elif type(data['test_skip_tags']) == list: mol_tags.append(",".join(data['test_skip_tags'])) if ('test_tags' in data.keys() and data['tags'] and get('molecule_tags_enforce', True)): mol_tags.append('--tags') if type(data['test_tags']) == str: mol_tags.append(data['test_tags']) elif type(data['test_tags']) == list: mol_tags.append(",".join(data['test_tags'])) return mol_tags alltags = set_molecule_tags(os.getcwd(), scenario) if alltags: cmd.extend(alltags)

commit_message:
Ironic: Require number for IronicIPXEPort

This parameter determines the tcp port used by PXE server, thus its
value should be a number rather than a string.

This also fixes the issue caused by puppetlabs-apache 8.0.0 which
requires an integer value for apache::vhost::port.

The logic to generate http_url is refactored using the str_replace
template function.

Partial-Bug: #1988053
Change-Id: I2a47db5a91400d5321ad6f3750cf75281cb89d08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/29/855129/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: type: number ironic::conductor::http_url: make_url: scheme: http host: str_replace: template: "%{lookup('$NETWORK_uri')}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, IronicNetwork]} port: {get_param: IronicIPXEPort}
deleted_lines: type: string ironic_conductor_http_host: str_replace: template: "%{lookup('$NETWORK_uri')}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, IronicNetwork]} ironic::conductor::http_url: list_join: - '' - - 'http://' - "%{lookup('ironic_conductor_http_host')}:" - {get_param: IronicIPXEPort}

commit_message:
remove unicode prefix from code

All strings are considered as unicode string from Python 3.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I73a9e82224e1fe47c63d3b6e4e5f409703225021

subject: Release final oslo.metrics for Zed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-22 13:29:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/a6ed69106ff1e979c6095f9604b5b73957c09580', 'message': 'Release final oslo.metrics for Zed

This proposed a release for oslo.metrics to get any final merged
changes out prior to the lib freeze for Zed going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, August 26.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I65e4b1ffde65ae0af5e69d53c9b8820bfd760679

commit_message:
Release final oslo.metrics for Zed

This proposed a release for oslo.metrics to get any final merged
changes out prior to the lib freeze for Zed going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, August 26.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I65e4b1ffde65ae0af5e69d53c9b8820bfd760679

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I93da9ce52bed2b3e8a467491d2a61bfd2ed4ea7d

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I1a250a0591c15971840bbd6130c7cff3822eed4f

subject: Improve error message heuristics with jsonschema>=4.8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-30 15:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/utils.py', 'ironic/common/args.py', 'releasenotes/notes/jsonschema-4.8-1146d103b877cffd.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/0e302b79c798901ba87542e674e6fae08ced7abe', 'message': "Improve error message heuristics with jsonschema>=4.8

Before version 4.8, jsonschema did some wild guessing when producing
error messages for schemas with several equivalent subschemas. In
version 4.8 it is no longer done, causing error messages that are more
correct but also more generic.

This change restores guessing the potential root cause without claiming
that it's the only possible root cause. Also the traits schema is
simplified to make it less ambiguous.

See https://github.com/python-jsonschema/jsonschema/issues/991 for details.

Change-Id: Ia75cecd2bfbc602b8b2b85bdda20fdc04c5eadf4
(cherry picked from commit 62f9c61ae6657227fd1f5dbc86c59a22b6bac28f)
"}]
commit_message:
Improve error message heuristics with jsonschema>=4.8

Before version 4.8, jsonschema did some wild guessing when producing
error messages for schemas with several equivalent subschemas. In
version 4.8 it is no longer done, causing error messages that are more
correct but also more generic.

This change restores guessing the potential root cause without claiming
that it's the only possible root cause. Also the traits schema is
simplified to make it less ambiguous.

See https://github.com/python-jsonschema/jsonschema/issues/991 for details.

Change-Id: Ia75cecd2bfbc602b8b2b85bdda20fdc04c5eadf4
(cherry picked from commit 62f9c61ae6657227fd1f5dbc86c59a22b6bac28f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/31/855231/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes API error messages with jsonschema>=4.8. A possible root cause is now detected for generic schema errors.

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: Icacd940f1e632d72c595c8a8b8a337dfbe8e1c46

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: Iea3649e0ef4fa1a2c4383c91e9a610a3448f7612
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-pacemaker-remote refs/changes/09/847509/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: allowlist_externals = charmcraft bash tox rename.shdeps = -r{toxinidir}/build-requirements.txt commands = charmcraft clean charmcraft -v build {toxinidir}/rename.sh [testenv:build-reactive] basepython = python3[testenv:func-target] # Hack to get functional tests working in the charmcraft # world. We should fix this. basepython = python3 passenv = HOME TERM CS_* OS_* TEST_* deps = -r{toxinidir}/src/test-requirements.txt changedir = {toxinidir}/src commands = bash -c "if [ ! -f ../*.charm ]; then echo 'Charm does not exist. Run tox -e build'; exit 1; fi" tox --version tox -e func-target {posargs}

subject: Add Kinetic and Zed support

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I93da9ce52bed2b3e8a467491d2a61bfd2ed4ea7d

subject: [security] Make Ironic tftpd run as nobody
revisions:

This avoids root privileges in tftpd's unprivileged container.

Change-Id: I50366205c9cefe2af26c27580c02368f029b7605

commit_message:
[security] Make Ironic tftpd run as nobody

This avoids root privileges in tftpd's unprivileged container.

Change-Id: I50366205c9cefe2af26c27580c02368f029b7605
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/41/854841/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "command": "/usr/sbin/in.tftpd --verbose --foreground --user nobody --address 0.0.0.0:69 --map-file /map-file /var/lib/ironic/tftpboot",

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py

Change-Id: I49a8b75ee2696632d105abc23d8a467e8c157179

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I2cb698f719106e54b06009f24ea47259419e9cad

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I4cae0a313230a8617beac36a2dbfe0c019c5e0de

commit_message:
Release final python-neutronclient for Zed

This is a release for python-neutronclient to get any merged but
unreleased changes out prior to the client lib freeze for Zed going
into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

commit_message:
Release final python-cinderclient for Zed

This is a release for python-cinderclient to get any merged but
unreleased changes out prior to the client lib freeze for Zed going
into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 2nd.

We are doing a minor version bump since it is enabling cinderclient to
use 2 new features introduced in cinder in the Zed development cycle.

- 3.69 - Allow null value for shared_targets
- 3.70 - Support encrypted volume transfers

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 9.0.0..1f3b663
1f3b663 Fix extension loading from python path

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: If8c58735b1f24ba6a77800ca5dfbc49a75e5a09a

- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: Ib0d4c3c656a39de43812dace491cff53e6b5cda7
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: Ib0d4c3c656a39de43812dace491cff53e6b5cda7

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: I4fd0343dfe3482ac59c6ea2164762d8281efcb7b

commit_message:
Add exception handling to share server deletion

Automatic share server deletion can happen in a scenario where two
threads try to delete the same share server at once. We weren't
preventing that exception. This change adds an exception handling
to that case.

Related-Bug: 1587835
Change-Id: Ie7b6fe33de7b3dc74e9ca48a8847911c3a006a47

commit_message:
PCI device tracking in Placement

This change introduces a spec to describe
modeling of PCI device using Placement.

Blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement

Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <smooney@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6c822427031b6162b3ead8562256d2e80f9070b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/47/791047/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ===== Title ===== header 1 ======== header 2 -------- header 3 ~~~~~~~~ ================================ PCI Device Tracking In Placement ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pci-device-tracking-in-placement The OpenStack Placement service was designed to provide tracking of quantitative resources via resource class inventories and qualitative characteristic via traits. Over the last few cycle nova has utilised placement to track basic resources such as CPUs, RAM and disk and more complex resources such as Virtual GPUs. This spec describes how Nova can utilise placement to track generic PCI devices. Problem description =================== Nova has supported generic stateless PCI passthrough for many release using a dedicated PCI tracker in conjunction with a scheduler post filter. The pci tracker is responsible for tracking which pci devices are available, claimed and allocated, the capabilities of the device, its consumer when claimed or allocated as well as the type of pci device and location. The pci passthrough filter is responsible for ensuring that devices requested by the vm exist on a host during scheduling. These pci request come form 2 sources: flavor based pci requests are generated using pci alias flavor extra specs and the second source of pci requests are neutron ports. While the current approach to pci tracking works there are some limitations in the current design and there is room for optimization. limitation 1 ~~~~~~~~~~~~ During server create pci devices are not claimed until the instance_claim is created on the compute node. As a result its possible for two concurrent server create requests to race for the last device on a host. limitation 2 ~~~~~~~~~~~~ While nova today tracks the capabilities of network interfaces in the pci_devices extra info table and the pci passthrough filter could match on those capabilities there is no user facing way to express a request for an SR-IOV neutron port with a specific network capability e.g. TSO optimisation 1 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Today when the virt driver is assigning a pci device on the compute hosts it need to look at all available pci device on the host and select one that fulfils the pci and numa requirements. If we model pci device in placement we only need to consider the devices associated with the placement allocation. optimisation 2 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Today when we schedule we perform host filtering of viable hosts based on pci device in python. by utilising placement we can move that filtering to sql. Use Cases --------- As an operator i want vm creation to atomically claim resource to avoid retries. As an operator i want to sorten the time it takes to select a host by running less filters. As an operator i want to utilise traits and resource classes to model pci aliases for more expressive device management. As an operator i want to be able to associate quotas with pci device usage. .. Note:: Device quotas would require unified limits to be implemented. Implementing quotas is out of scope of this spec beyond enabling the usecase by modelling PCI device in placement. Proposed change =============== pci whitelist ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The pci whitelist will be extended to support 2 additional standard tags ``RC`` and ``traits`` The ``RC`` tag will be a allowed only when the physical_network is not defined and will allow a pci device to be associated with a custom resouce class. Each pci whitelist entry may have at most 1 resouce class associated with it. devices that have a physical_network tag will be mapped to a new standard ``SRIOV_NET_PF`` if the pci_device type is ``type-PCI`` or ``type-PF`` and the existing ``SRIOV_NET_VF`` will be used for device of ``type-VF``. ``VDPA`` devices will be mapped to a new standard ``VDPA_NET_VF`` resouce class. Where a pci device does not have a physical_network or a RC tag present it will be reported with a generated custom resource class. The resouce class will be ``CUSTOM_<Vendor_id>_<product_id>``. The ``traits`` tag will be a comma separated list of standard or custom traits that will be reported for a device. .. Note:: Initially traits will only be additive, in the future if we need to we can allow traits to be removed using a +/- syntax but this is not included in the scope of this spec. As detailed in the Moddeling device in placment section, each physical device (PF) will be its own resouce provider with inventories of the relevent inventories. as such traits cannot vary per VF/VDPA device. Open Question while we are here shoudl we rename the [pci]/passthroug_whitelist to something else? [pci]/device_include_list? [pci]/device_filter? pci alias ~~~~~~~~~ The pci alias definition will be extended to support matching on a resource class and required and forbidden traits. When a resource class is specified, a vendor id and product id will no longer be required. placement prefilter ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ A new prefilter will be added to convert pci request in to placement resource requests. each pci request will be its own placement group. The prefilter will be disabled by default to enable upgrades and will be enabled by default in a future release. if an pci_request comes form an alias and the aliase does not have a resouce class associated with it it will be computed using the vendor and product id ``CUSTOM_<Vendor_id>_<product_id>``. Modelling device in Placement _____________________________ PCI device modelling in placment will closely mirror that of vGPUs. Each pci device of type ``type-pci`` and ``type-PF`` will be moddeled as a placment resouce provider, who name is ``<hypervior_hostname>_<pci_address>`` the RP name will normalised to remove special characters excluding ``:``, ``-`` and ``.``. each pci device RP will have inventories of the appriate standard and custom resouce classes. To support the current model where a pci device can have VFs configured but can be dynmical consumed as either a VF or a PF the following logic will be applied. given a pci device we N VFs, an RP will be create with a PF invenotry of 1 and a VF inventory of n. If a request woudl consome 1 VF the PF inventoly will have reserved set to total i.e. 1. If a requstion woudl consume 1 PF then the same logic is applied in revews with the VF inventory beign updated to set reserved==total. libvirt driver ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ??? hardware.py ~~~~~~~~~~~ the pci numa affinity code will need to be modifed to limit the pci devices considerd to just those inlcuded in the allocation canidate summary. Alternatives ------------ * we could not track pci devices in placement. * we could track each pci device record as a spereate RP. This would result in each VF havign its own RP allowing each VF to have different traits. This is not proposed as it will signifcaly increase the poslibel perumation fo alloaction candiates per host. * we could device to only support consuming a pci device statically as a PF or VF to avoid the need to set resreved == total. * we could model each PCI device under a numa node. This can be done in the future by moveing the RP under a numa node RP instead of the compute node RP but its declared out of scope of this inital spec. * we could modify neutron to pass resouce resuqest for pci deivce resouce classes and trait using the port resouce request mechanium instead of usign the prefilter to do that. since we need the prefilter for the pci aliase case there is currently no value in modifying neutron to do this. * ??? Data model impact ----------------- The pci_request_spec object will be exetended to include forbbiden and required traits, and a resource class. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ In general this is expected to imporve schduling performance but should have no runtime performance on guests. the intoduction of a new prefilter will make the computation of the placment query slightly longer and the resolting execution time may increase for instnaces with pci requests but should have no effect for instnace without pci requests. This added complexity is expected to be ofset by the removal of the requirement to enabel the PCIPassthrough scheduler filter. As a result of the offloading of the filtering to placment and the removal of reschedules do to racing for the last pci device on a host the over all performance is expected to improve. Other deployer impact --------------------- To utilise the new feature the operator will have to define 2 new config options. 1 to enable the palacement prefilter and a second to enabel reporting of pci devices to placement. (note to reviewers im not sure if we actually need the second option if we can simple have 1 config option for the placement prefilter that would be my preference. this is only added to that you have something on the comptue node to not report pci device to placment if you dont have the pci prefilter enabled and too trigger the reshape of placment allocations.) Developer impact ---------------- None? How does this impact move operations? do we need to modify move_calims or sriov live migration outside of how the device is claimed in the pci tracker to take acount of the palcment allocations. do we need to pass the allocations to any virt driver api where they are not currently present? i think the answer is no on the virt dirver api change or rpc cahgnes with regard to move operation as we are already claiming the devices in the pci tracker and passing that infomation back and forth as needed. Upgrade impact -------------- TODO the high level plan is as follows * upgade all host to xena * define [compute]/placement_pci_reporting=true ** this will reshape all allocation for exisig instance with pcidevies. ** this will enable reporting of pci devices to placment ** we coudl just alwasy do this instead but i belive that will force a fallback query below. * enable schduler prefiler. ** open question is do we need to support a fallback query approch like we do with PCPUs *** if yes then we need to first qury with the pci reuquest and then fallback to not including them Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <launchpad-id or None> Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: sean-k-mooney Work Items ---------- TODO * prefilter * whitelist change * alias change * translate pci extra info capablites to standard traits * extend pci_request object * placement reshape * ... Dependencies ============ This spec has no direct dependcy on any spec but it has an indirect depency on unified limits to support quotas on pci devices by resouce class. Testing ======= As this is a pci passthough related feature it cannot be tested in upstream tempest. testing will be primarly done via the extensive unit and functional test suite that exists for pci device instance with numa toplogy in the libvirt funcitonal tests. Documentation Impact ==================== The pci passthough doc will have to be rewiten to document the new resouce_class and traits tags for the pci whitelist and pci alias. References ========== TODO add unified limts, PCPU in placmnet and vGPU spec links here. History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Xena - Introduced

[CI] Run the cells scenario on Ubuntu

With CentOS-based jobs disabled, we don't have any job testing the
cells scenario. This patch adds it for Ubuntu.

commit_message:
Change conditions for checking if DIB_RELEASE is greater than 7

The Centos 8 and 9 stream DIB_RELEASE variable include '-stream' suffix,
so some conditions that are comparing to the number are skipped.

Change-Id: Idffa5b45fd6c8e8e6278ff4128f51116a07ff5d6

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: I06ce0a361d6011752ed6d98660a57adab3f0866c

commit_message:
Allow for jinja2 templating of puppet_config

In support of the wider Multi-RHEL effort. We will
need to support templating to allow for Ansible to
determine which container needs to be pulled to
the hosts based on their OS version.

This change adds support for that templating of
the puppet_config files.

Change-Id: I5b6a34c4013ad86585bdbd29dab882dd0dd1b3e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/97/853897/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: content: "{{ lookup('file', tripleo_role_name + '/puppet_config.yaml', errors='ignore') | default([], True) | from_yaml | to_nice_json }}"

commit_message:
Add haproxy-source backend element in DIB

Build haproxy from sources for CentOS or Ubuntu.
Enabled with "-b haproxy-source" flag in diskimage-create.sh

Default to the latest release (based on haproxy.org output). Version can
be overriden using DIB_HAPROXY_SOURCE_OCTAVIA_HAPROXY_VERSION env
variable.  (ex: export
DIB_HAPROXY_SOURCE_OCTAVIA_HAPROXY_VERSION=2.4-dev2)

The element also enables QUIC support and builds the quictls library.

A new job octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-haproxy-latest is also added as a
non-voting job.

Change-Id: I1525ed4790f324b2796111e2586ee915540707d5

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright 2017 Rackspace, US Inc. # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. set -eu set -o pipefail ping_cmd=$(command -v ping) ping6_cmd=$(command -v ping6) cat > /var/lib/octavia/ping-wrapper.sh <<EOF #!/bin/bash if [[ \$HAPROXY_SERVER_ADDR =~ ":" ]]; then $ping6_cmd -q -n -w 1 -c 1 \$HAPROXY_SERVER_ADDR > /dev/null 2>&1 else $ping_cmd -q -n -w 1 -c 1 \$HAPROXY_SERVER_ADDR > /dev/null 2>&1 fi EOF chmod 755 /var/lib/octavia/ping-wrapper.sh

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: I3b55cab31ec9d1f94038c4d01ad44711b92cd96d

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: I13cd9f3ca9a17eb9b7e0c6ea5b02a86cbabfacd9

commit_message:
Add WebTest as dependency for testing

Latest pecan release dropped this dependency. This is why now it is
needed to explicitly install it during testing.

commit_message:
Add scheduler_default_extend_filters option.

Instead of using all default filters of share create operation, use only
necessary list of filters for share extend operation. A new config
option `scheduler_default_extend_filters` is added to provide such list
of filters e.g. CapacityFilter.

Closes-Bug: #1973621
Change-Id: I162325f3096227b74a58b9a55de4660668454d4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/25/853425/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | When using scheduler filters during share extend, only few filters are necessary. To provide those configurable list of filters for share extend, added new option `scheduler_default_extend_filters`.

commit_message:
tls_proxy: Make sure port is an integer

The apache::vhost::port parameter no longer accepts a string value and
now an integer value is required. This change makes sure the port is
converted to an integer value even if a string value is passed.

Partial-Bug: #1988053
Change-Id: I52f099b5ab198c8cd02bbe73a4fe491b86c6d442

commit_message:
Delete existing dstat files during teardown

Currently dstat-csv.log file is only deleted during teardown.
other dstat files dstat.{html, txt} if stays from the previous run
then it will eat up the space on the system leading to disk_full
issue in the job.

Cleaning up these files during teardown process, will avoid such
issues.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ide52cf94eb94d22cf8b789d041a0d260afad81fb

commit_message:
Fix documents for replaced configuration name

Since 4.0, '--os-url' global option is no longer supported.
And this option had been replaced to '--os-endpoint'

- Refer Change-Id: I1b9fbb96e447889a41b705324725a2ffc8ecfd9f
- Refer Docs: doc/source/cli/backwards-incompatible.rs

I fixed in documents as below
- OPTIONS: '--os-url' to '--os-endpoint'
- ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES: 'OS_URL' to 'OS_ENDPOINT'
- and relevant sentence

Change-Id: Ibb0cddf34375df941678ee07a005d81399ec7195

commit_message:
DNM: Demonstrate powermax unit test failures

Adding a couple of sleeps to the powermax unit tests shows failures
occurring.  This indicates that some items are not properly mocked.

$ tox -e py39 -- powermax --concurrency 3

cinder.tests.unit.volume.drivers.dell_emc.powermax.test_powermax_masking.PowerMaxMaskingTest.test_move_volume_between_storage_groups

File "cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/test_powermax_masking.py", line 179, in test_move_volume_between_storage_groups
    mck_mod.assert_called_with(

    AssertionError: expected call not found.
Expected: modify_storage_group('000197800123', 'OS-HostX-SRP_1-Diamond-DSS-OS-iscsi-PG', {'executionOption': 'ASYNCHRONOUS', 'editStorageGroupActionParam': {'moveVolumeToStorageGroupParam': {'volumeId': ['00001'], 'storageGroupId': 'OS-HostX-SRP_1-DiamondDSS-OS-fibre-PG', 'force': 'false'}}})
Actual: modify_storage_group('000197800123', 'OS-HostX-SRP_1-Diamond-DSS-OS-iscsi-PG', {'executionOption': 'ASYNCHRONOUS', 'editStorageGroupActionParam': {'moveVolumeToStorageGroupParam': {'volumeId': ['00001'], 'storageGroupId': 'OS-HostX-SRP_1-DiamondDSS-OS-fibre-PG', 'force': 'true'}}})

cinder.tests.unit.volume.drivers.dell_emc.powermax.test_powermax_rest.PowerMaxRestTest.test_check_force

 File "cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/test_powermax_rest.py", line 2485, in test_check_force
    self.assertEqual(

    testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: 'false' != 'true'

Change-Id: Ia6a0ba76e5a57d0a279b0e0d51e89ce5d7deae1d

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I85e5b06143ea05bb726cb8fc27f89ec661fc26b3

commit_message:
Improve error message heuristics with jsonschema>=4.8

Before version 4.8, jsonschema did some wild guessing when producing
error messages for schemas with several equivalent subschemas. In
version 4.8 it is no longer done, causing error messages that are more
correct but also more generic.

This change restores guessing the potential root cause without claiming
that it's the only possible root cause. Also the traits schema is
simplified to make it less ambiguous.

See https://github.com/python-jsonschema/jsonschema/issues/991 for details.

Change-Id: Ia75cecd2bfbc602b8b2b85bdda20fdc04c5eadf4
(cherry picked from commit 62f9c61ae6657227fd1f5dbc86c59a22b6bac28f)

commit_message:
Improve error message heuristics with jsonschema>=4.8

Before version 4.8, jsonschema did some wild guessing when producing
error messages for schemas with several equivalent subschemas. In
version 4.8 it is no longer done, causing error messages that are more
correct but also more generic.

This change restores guessing the potential root cause without claiming
that it's the only possible root cause. Also the traits schema is
simplified to make it less ambiguous.

See https://github.com/python-jsonschema/jsonschema/issues/991 for details.

Change-Id: Ia75cecd2bfbc602b8b2b85bdda20fdc04c5eadf4
(cherry picked from commit 62f9c61ae6657227fd1f5dbc86c59a22b6bac28f)

subject: Respect constraints on tempest venv consistently
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-02 08:27:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/050ad6cdaed782a80ff0002aa12abcd881046895', 'message': 'Respect constraints on tempest venv consistently

In case of online mode, there is a procedure to recreate tempest venv.
For consistency of tempest venv during the entire stack.sh process,
add logic to consider the TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS option here.

In case of offline mode, the existing logic is maintained.
In other words, it does not recreate the tempest venv, but re-checks
and updates the package dependencies including the upper constraints
within the existing venv.

commit_message:
Respect constraints on tempest venv consistently

In case of online mode, there is a procedure to recreate tempest venv.
For consistency of tempest venv during the entire stack.sh process,
add logic to consider the TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS option here.

Closes-bug: #1980483
Signed-off-by: June Yi <june.yi@samsung.com>
Change-Id: I0cea282152fd363af8671cab1b5f733ebe2bd4df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/82/848482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Respect constraints on tempest venv if [[ "$OFFLINE" == "True" ]]; then tox -evenv-tempest -- pip install -c $tmp_u_c_m -r requirements.txt else tox -revenv-tempest --notest fi
deleted_lines: # NOTE(mtreinish): Respect constraints on tempest verify-config venv if [[ "$OFFLINE" != "True" ]]; then tox -revenv-tempest --notest fi tox -evenv-tempest -- pip install -c $tmp_u_c_m -r requirements.txt

commit_message:
Remove unneeded parameter tripleo_frr_ovn_bgp_agent_bridge_mappings

Thanks to [1] the agent itself is in charge of managing the
arp/ndp status of the bridges. So no need to handle this at
deployment time

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/x/ovn-bgp-agent/+/854957

commit_message:
Remove unneeded parameter tripleo_frr_ovn_bgp_agent_bridge_mappings

Thanks to [1] the agent itself is in charge of managing the
arp/ndp status of the bridges. So no need to handle this at
deployment time. This is being removed from tripleo-ansible
in [2]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/x/ovn-bgp-agent/+/854957
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/854958

Change-Id: I3a016f5e4a37826b08ccbe3dc0e46e93570c3cc0

subject: Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-29 12:39:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/agent/common.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/use_random_fully-527b20bc524c308a.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e7f8b93a8a2159b59c94657400da86cebf7b450f', 'message': 'Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)
(cherry picked from commit fa77abbc153dcf040a95f6a001d6661e07c25096)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)
(cherry picked from commit fa77abbc153dcf040a95f6a001d6661e07c25096)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/95/854995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add ``use_random_fully`` setting to allow an operator to disable the iptables random-fully property on an iptable rules. issues: - | If the ``use_random_fully`` setting is disabled, it will prevent random fully from being used and if there're 2 guests in different networks using the same source_ip and source_port and they try to reach the same dest_ip and dest_port, packets might be dropped in the kernel do to the racy tuple generation . Disabling this setting should only be done if source_port is really important such as in network firewall ACLs and that the source_ip are never repeating within the platform.

subject: Bump revision number of objects when description is changed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-29 08:53:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/revisions/revision_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/revisions/test_revision_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/39f7e1299364f3eca6375c178b604f70a05c0d81', 'message': 'Bump revision number of objects when description is changed

"Description" attribute belongs to the StandardAttribute class from
which many other classes inherits (like e.g. Network, Port or Subnet).
In case when only description of object is updated, revision number of
the object should be bumped but it wasn't the case for all of the
objects. For example updated description of the Network or Router didn't
bumped its revision_number. It was like that because StandardAttribute
object was the only one which was dirty in the session, and as it is not
member of the HasStandardAttibutes class, it was filtered out.

Now, to fix that problem revision_plugin looks in the session.dirty list
for objects which inherits from HasStandardAttibutes class (as it was
before) but also for StandardAttribute objects to bump revision numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1981817
Closes-Bug: #1865173
Change-Id: I79b40a8ae5d594ed6fc875572663469c8b701202
(cherry picked from commit 4c9cb83d6b46a6425e603194649a61f51a07a307)
'}]
commit_message:
Bump revision number of objects when description is changed

"Description" attribute belongs to the StandardAttribute class from
which many other classes inherits (like e.g. Network, Port or Subnet).
In case when only description of object is updated, revision number of
the object should be bumped but it wasn't the case for all of the
objects. For example updated description of the Network or Router didn't
bumped its revision_number. It was like that because StandardAttribute
object was the only one which was dirty in the session, and as it is not
member of the HasStandardAttibutes class, it was filtered out.

Now, to fix that problem revision_plugin looks in the session.dirty list
for objects which inherits from HasStandardAttibutes class (as it was
before) but also for StandardAttribute objects to bump revision numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1981817
Closes-Bug: #1865173
Change-Id: I79b40a8ae5d594ed6fc875572663469c8b701202
(cherry picked from commit 4c9cb83d6b46a6425e603194649a61f51a07a307)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/854909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[OVN] Remove ACLs with remote SG during deletion of SG

When a security group is removed, the rules having this security
group as remote are removed. But the OVN ACL registers related
to those rules are not removed. This patch catches the security
group deletion precommit event to perform this cleanup.

Closes-Bug: #1983600

Change-Id: I6bb84cb748a2f80f2ff640ceeb3223413f7e92c7
(cherry picked from commit 1957353ef92ec11766a2ce3d29d51afa8d7fdb3e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/854558/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: registry.subscribe(self._delete_security_group_precommit, resources.SECURITY_GROUP, events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE) def _delete_security_group_precommit(self, resource, event, trigger, payload): context = n_context.get_admin_context() security_group_id = payload.resource_id for sg_rule in self._plugin.get_security_group_rules( context, filters={'remote_group_id': [security_group_id]}): self._ovn_client.delete_security_group_rule(context, sg_rule)

commit_message:
NetApp OnTap: Fix compatibility check for share migrate

The issue happens when the parameter 'encrypt-destination' is sent to
OnTap devices with version lower than 9.0 or OnTapi lower then 1.110.

This patch adds a condition to check these versions and ignore the flag
addition if needed on '_send_volume_move_request'.

Closes-Bug: 1915237
Change-Id: Id9faa4f73996cb7467b7361d0406c980f06905c2
(cherry picked from commit 9417ece45629d4103d2b37a593dfbcc7e774362c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/61/847161/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.features.FLEXVOL_ENCRYPTION: if encrypt_destination: api_args['encrypt-destination'] = 'true' else: api_args['encrypt-destination'] = 'false'
deleted_lines: if self.features.FLEXVOL_ENCRYPTION and encrypt_destination: api_args['encrypt-destination'] = 'true' else: api_args['encrypt-destination'] = 'false'

commit_message:
Add Gage Hugo candidacy for OpenStack-Helm PTL

Change-Id: Ia673b66a4c3d44cc977a3282b8d836da23d29c89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/94/855094/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello everyone, I would like to continue serving as the OpenStack-Helm PTL for the Antelope cycle. We managed to complete a long-term goal in the Zed cycle of reducing the number of repositories under the OpenStack-Helm umbrella that were no longer used. The project as a whole has continued the work to keep up-to-date with any changes around kubernetes and helm with the help of several contributors. As PTL I would like to make sure this work continues on to allow OpenStack-Helm to provide a stable way to deploy OpenStack via Helm & Kubernetes. Thank you! - Gage Hugo (gagehugo)

added_lines: Hi, I would like to self-nominate for the role of PTL of Blazar for the Antelope release cycle. I have been PTL since the Stein cycle and I am willing to continue in this role. Though we had a quiet Zed cycle, we still have various improvements in the pipeline and I want to help the community deliver them to make Blazar more useful. Thank you for your support, Pierre Riteau (priteau)

commit_message:
Add CentOS 9 Stream job

Go ahead and move the FIPS job to CentOS 9; there doesn't seem to be
much value in having more than one FIPS job.

Change-Id: I8c2c95e490ec083116f2ed7b9fb0d66918424fb7

commit_message:
update hacking pin to support flake8 3.8.3

this change updates the max version of hacking
to 4.1.0 to allow pre-commit to work with the
flake 3.8.3 release and correct one new error that was
raised as a result.

Change-Id: I3a0242208f411b430db0e7429e2c773f45b3d301

commit_message:
Fix haproxy prechecks after deployment

HAProxy prechecks could fail if the ansible_user was not allowed
to access Docker API.

commit_message:
mariadb: Fix RPM repository URLs

The MariaDB project changed the location of the repositories, and the
old URLs no longer work.

Fix added for stable branches: Wrap version detection for docker module
since it can fail for docker >= 6.0.

Change-Id: Ia094cd1e29232c47d1fb26e00de569677bc5b8a1
(cherry picked from commit 94fad9f26bc056e9f049ff63fde5ef163eae43dc)

subject: Deprecate linux bridge usage in data-port config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-15 08:31:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-gateway/commit/ec81c815b3f846eabd99ba7606f2e45c6421d0ab', 'message': 'Deprecate linux bridge usage in data-port config

f832f1073d47a430111c59563962922dfe37a0a5 addressed LP: #1635067 by
adding support for using pre-created Linux bridges in the data-port
config option.

The same use-case of reusing a single physical interface for VLAN
interfaces and plugging it into an OVS bridge can be addressed in a
different way by plugging the physical interface directly into the OVS
bridge and creating VLAN interfaces on that physical interface - this
does not require the use of veth pairs which is problematic due to the
performance reasons and lack of support for in netplan for veth pairs at
the time of writing.

There is a procedure to move from the setup with Linux bridge and veth
pair used to the one that does not which will be documented to migrate
the existing environments in-place.

commit_message:
Deprecate linux bridge usage in data-port config

f832f1073d47a430111c59563962922dfe37a0a5 addressed LP: #1635067 by
adding support for using pre-created Linux bridges in the data-port
config option.

The same use-case of reusing a single physical interface for VLAN
interfaces and plugging it into an OVS bridge can be addressed in a
different way by plugging the physical interface directly into the OVS
bridge and creating VLAN interfaces on that physical interface - this
does not require the use of veth pairs which is problematic due to the
performance reasons and lack of support for in netplan for veth pairs at
the time of writing.

There is a procedure to move from the setup with Linux bridge and veth
pair used to the one that does not which will be documented to migrate
the existing environments in-place.

Change-Id: I2803b55659a0b2b1b540f24eda2758f278d7d11c
Partial-Bug: #1877594
